name: Pleurothallis
description: Specklinia grobyi (synonym: Pleurothallis grobyi), commonly known as Pleurothallis, is a small epiphytic orchid native to Central and South America, particularly cloud forests and montane regions. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and features small, compact growth with narrow, dark green leaves (5-15 cm long) arranged in a fan-like pattern. The plant produces small but intricate flowers (often less than 1 cm) in various colors including yellow, orange, red, and purple. Many Pleurothallis species have highly specialized flowers designed for specific pollinators. The plant displays an upright, compact growth habit and typically reaches 5-15 cm in height. In its native cloud forest habitat, it grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks and branches in cool, humid, high-altitude environments. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant brings exotic elegance and sophistication with its intricate, small flowers. It's popular among orchid enthusiasts for its diversity and unique floral structures.
